pageContext.claim: “We have millions of people that, over the years, have been released into the community. They never show up for the trials. They never come back. They're never seen again. …  And then they never show up -- almost. It's like a level of 3 percent. They never show up for the trial. So by the time their trial comes, they're gone. Nobody knows where they are.”
pageContext.analysis: This is false. The vast majority of asylum-seekers show up for their hearings, according to Justice Department statistics, anywhere from 89 percent to 94 percent since fiscal 2013.
